SENATE COMMERCE COMMITTEE
IN SUPPORT OF 8. 1160
Thursday, April 13, 1967
I want to thank you for the opportunity to appear
before this distinguished subcommittee to support legislation
which I believe is among the more important measures which
faces this Congress. I believe we should continue providing
necessary help in the development of public broadcasting

The necessity for this grows out of the nature of
broadcasting. We accept the public philosophy that government
should help people do in concert what they cannot do individ¬
ually. Because the nature of broadcasting limits the number
who may have the privilege and imposes high costs for complex
equipment and creation of programs, public action is required
to assure the development of informational and educational
media.
I cannot emphasize the public role too much because the
media of communication which the bill before this subcommittee
would assist, serve segments of the public no other medium can
